content.question: A <math alttext="1.0 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="H 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> and a <math alttext="1.0 mole" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>mol</mi></math> sample of <math alttext="I 2, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> are placed in a previously evacuated <math alttext="1.0 liter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math> container and allowed to reach the equilibrium shown above. If the equilibrium concentration of <math alttext="H I, gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>HI</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is <math alttext="0.40 molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.40</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></math>, which of the following is the value of the equilibrium constant?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
